item.title: Privacy Preserving Human Pose Estimation
item.description:
Digital cameras are becoming increasingly ubiquitous and pervasive. This is leading an increasing concern in computer vision about privacy and security of the users. In particular, it is desired a computer vision system that can recognize important events and assist human daily lives by understanding images and videos but ensuring that they do not intrude people’s privacy. In typical cameras, the optical system is designed first to obtain an all-in-focus image. Then, after the data acquisition, the privacy-preserving image processing algorithms are applied to protect user’s privacy. However, the sensitive data was already acquired by the camera. In this work, we propose an end-to-end design of the optical system to directly acquire a privacy-preserving image while ensuring a good human pose estimation. We design the lenses using the Zernike polynomials and using the gradients from OpenPose network.
